page.title: 05Swan Market at Yardley
page.content: The Swan Market's aim is to join people together so they won't have to buy a big shop on the High Street. They pay lower rents and no rates. The Swan Market took 8 weeks to build from just a shell.It used to be called Key Markets. It cost 38000 pounds in adver- tising before it was opened by Larry Grayson on Nov. 8th 1984. The Market covers an area of 40000 square feet.It has 166 units to rent for between 24 & 46 pounds a week.Better units such as corners or near entrances cost most. 75000 people a week visit the market. 500 people a day use the cafe.150 people work at stalls varying from butchers to winemaking. A special bus brings 1800 people a week. 800 child- ren a week use the creche which cont- ains toys worth 8000 pounds.1000 pounds a week is spent in advertising and promotions.
